goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between distance and flight time?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. air_time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between distance and flight time, which can help us optimize flight schedules.

goals.question: What is the most common origin airport?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common origin airport, which can help us optimize flight routes and schedules.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight cancellations and the proportion of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight distances?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of flight distances and the frequency of flights at different distances.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-10k.json')

# Convert date fields to date types
data['departure_time'] = pd.to_datetime(data['departure_time'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')
data = data[pd.notna(data['departure_time'])]

# Create histogram of departure_delay
sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', kde=True, color='blue')

# Add vertical line for median delay time
median_delay = data['departure_delay'].median()
plt.axvline(median_delay, color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f'Median delay: {median_delay:.2f}')

# Set chart title and axis labels
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?')
plt.xlabel('Departure Delay (minutes)')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')

# Add legend
plt.legend()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-10k.json')

# Convert date fields to date types
data['dep_time'] = pd.to_datetime(data['dep_time'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')
data['arr_time'] = pd.to_datetime(data['arr_time'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['dep_time'])]
data = data[pd.notna(data['arr_time'])]

# Create scatter plot
sns.scatterplot(x='distance', y='air_time', data=data)

# Add title and axis labels
plt.title('What is the relationship between distance and flight time?')
plt.xlabel('Distance')
plt.ylabel('Air Time')

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-10k.json')

# Plot bar chart of origin_airport
sns.set_style("whitegrid")
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
sns.countplot(x='origin_airport', data=data, order=data['origin_airport'].value_counts().index, palette='Blues_d')
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
plt.xlabel('Origin Airport')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.title('What is the most common origin airport?')

# Add vertical line for most common origin airport
most_common_origin = data['origin_airport'].value_counts().idxmax()
plt.axvline(x=most_common_origin, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Most common origin: {most_common_origin}')

# Add legend
plt.legend()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-10k.json')

# Pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
cancelled = data['cancelled'].value_counts()
plt.pie(cancelled, labels=['Not Cancelled', 'Cancelled'], autopct='%1.1f%%')
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?')

# Return plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flights-10k.json')

# Plot histogram of distance
sns.histplot(data=data, x='distance', kde=True, color='blue')
plt.axvline(data['distance'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean distance: {:.2f}'.format(data['distance'].mean()))
plt.legend()
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight distances?')
plt.xlabel('Distance (miles)')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.show()
```
